title: DIG Islamabad inaugurates Police khidmat Markaz at Soan Garden
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jan 19 (APP):Deputy Inspector General (DIG) Islamabad, Syed Ali Raza, inaugurated on Sunday the Police khidmat Markaz at Soan Garden to provide comprehensive police-related services to residents of suburban areas.
A Public Relations Officer (PRO) informed APP that the facility has been constructed in line with international standards, offering a range of services under one roof. DIG Raza emphasized that the center aims to enhance convenience for citizens residing in remote areas.
DIG Raza said that trained personnel have been deployed at the center to ensure quality service delivery. “Protecting the lives and property of citizens and providing them with essential facilities remain the top priority of the police,” DIG Ali Raza remarked.
Raza further stated that the Islamabad Police is committed to assisting citizens with a spirit of public service and ensuring the best possible support.
On this occasion, Chief Traffic Officer (CTO) Muhammad Sarfraz Virk, SP Soan Zone, a large number of citizens, and media representatives were also present.
